taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section arguti;species wisconsinensis;

treatment.description: Erect to reclining, with spreading to nearly procumbent branches, the canes soon terete, bristly; primocane-leaves mostly 3 (sometimes 5)-foliolate, the terminal round-ovate leaflet jagged-toothed and lobulate; inflorescence compact, the lower armed pedicels subtended by leafy bracts, these nearly or quite overtopping the upper flowers; corolla about 2 cm. broad; globose fruit hardly 1 cm. in diameter.
